aquarium.creatures

Class LineSwimmer

  • java.lang.Object
    • aquarium.creatures.ImageCreature
      • aquarium.creatures.LineSwimmer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Creature
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BoringFish

    public class LineSwimmer
extends ImageCreature
    A LineSwimmer is an ImageCreature which:
    • Moves at a given whole integer slope speed, in a straight line;
    • Bounces off of the walls, the floor, and the surface of the water, in order to stay underwater.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LineSwimmer(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String fileName, int speed)
      Creates a LineSwimmer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void hitClouds()
      Reverses course along the Y axis when the top of the Aquarium is hit.
      void hitFloor()
      Reverses course along the Y axis when the floor is hit.
      void hitLeftWall()
      Reverses course along the X axis when the left wall is hit.
      void hitRightWall()
      Reverses course along the X axis when the right wall is hit.
      void hitSurface()
      Reverses course along the Y axis when the surface of the water is hit.
      void updateLocation()
      Moves the LineSwimmer in the amount of its given speed in both the X and Y directions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LineSwimmer

        public LineSwimmer(java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String fileName,
                   int speed)
        Creates a LineSwimmer.
        Parameters:
        name - The friendly name for this LineSwimmer
        fileName - The name of the image file representing this LineSwimmer
        speed - The whole integer slope indicating how fast this LineSwimmer will move

        public void hitClouds()
